title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 July 2015 - XWiki

11:30 <vmassol> hmm just got another friend who sent me a spam URL on skype (same as sdumitriu yesterday). Seems there's a lot of skype hacking these days  
11:43 <Trefex2> has quit  
11:44 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <vmassol> FYI there are plenty of mails in the moderation queue for notifications@ list  
11:51 <vmassol> I've jut accepted 3 for the watchlist and 3 from github (comments to PR)  
11:51 <vmassol> they were over 100K  
11:52 <vmassol> and now there are 140 mails from jenkins held in the queue  
11:52 <vmassol> most have held because of "Too many recipients to the message" and several because of > 100K  
11:53 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <vmassol> it seems the mail service on xwiki.org has been down since the upgrade to 7.1.1  
12:12 <vmassol> just noticed that the port was 3025 instead of 25  
12:18 <vmassol> note: I fixed this in XWIKI-12039 normally  
12:32 <cjd> has quit  
12:32 <ClemensR> maybe who ever upgraded xwiki.org skipped the change in XWikPreferences coming in from the DW (which is something I would normally do)  
12:33 <vmassol> xwiki.org was on 6.4.2 before and we upgraded to 7.1.1  
12:33 <vmassol> 6.4.2 had the issue but I think we've received watchlist back then, would need to check what's the oldest watchlist mail we've received  
13:17 <gsmeria> has quit  
13:18 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:26 <vmassol> restarting jenkins  
13:38 <gsmeria> has quit  
13:48 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
14:34 <cjd> vmassol: I just tweaked the pull req from github web api but I'm going to try to test it before asking you to pull  
14:34 <vmassol> ok cjd  
14:34 <vmassol> thanks  
14:34 <vmassol> (I need to finish something first on my side but I'll try to look at it later today)  
14:34 <cjd> cool, sounds like we're well timed then  
14:35 <ramona\_> has quit  
14:38 <vmassol> hey we're almost in sync with Eclipse Mars with our Nested Spaces feature: Eclipse Mars is just offering hierarchical view of Nested Projects ;)  
14:39 <vmassol> I'm curious to see how easy oomph will be to use, it"s a great idea  
14:39 <vmassol> (forgot I had mentioned it at http://markmail.org/message/no6firosmj36i36z )  
15:11 <cjd> hm re distributionId it's changed for client projects ?  
15:13 <cjd> anyway force-pushed again  
15:13 <vmassol> not sure what you mean by client project but anyway dong its own distribution of xwiki must have a different id indeed  
15:13 <vmassol> s/anyway/anyone  
15:13 <vmassol> \*doing  
15:14 <cjd> well there are indeed some installs of Totem on something that is not actually XE  
15:14 <vmassol> yes, we only want to count XE here  
15:14 <cjd> because there are 3 on XE and 2 on "something else"  
15:15 <cjd> Personally I like to count my extensions installed on anything because it means users  
15:15 <vmassol> sure  
15:15 <vmassol> it's configurable in the Active install app btw  
15:15 <vmassol> but by default it's only XE that's counted  
15:16 <vmassol> so if you install that app on your instance of XWiki you can go to the config and remove the condition ;)  
15:16 <vmassol> the page is ActiveInstallsConfig  
15:17 <cjd> ahh yeah, #set($distributionId = "\*") I suppose  
15:17 <vmassol> using the admin is even eaier ;)  
15:17 <vmassol> \*easier
